text: A very nice porter. Coffee and chocolate in the aroma and in the taste. Very good compared to the price.
Dyb mørk porter med flot karamelfarvet skum. Duft af karamel og lakrids. Smag af lakreids, malt, chokolade m.m. Flot porter, ikke mindst til prisen.
Decent but extremely overrated. Sweet burnt caramel, roasted malt, soy sauce and some bitterness in the end. Not enough to ballance the sticky sweet booze.
Wow. en overraskende god porter. Masser af fylde og smag. Tilpas med bitterhed. Bliver måske lidt tung mod slutningen.

Black. The aroma is a bit metallic and not the selling point here. Full, roasted malty flavour, moderate sweetness and low bitterness. Full body. Overall, a good baltic porter. Straightforward, simple and tasty.

Bottle from Voldby K, shared with Niller - pitch black pour with off white head. Dark roasted and sweet malty with notes of cocoa, burnt caramel, some liquorice, earthy and nice charred smokey burnt malty notes, lovely stuff.

(bottle) deep black-brown colour with a frothy light-brown head. aroma of fudge and liquorice, with a light hint of vanilla, some dark chocolate and toasted malts. flavour is mostly roasted malts and soy sauce, with some more vanilla, fudge and a light touch of alcohol in the faintly roasted-bitter finish. medium- to heavy-bodied with soft carbonation. solid.
Bottle. Dark brown color with small beige ring. Aroma is sweet chocolate, lacto, tempting. Taste is sweet chocolate, a bit boozy, medium carbonation. Not bad.
Very nice, although not worth the insane ratings. Fairly full bodied and a very old fashioned stout.

Pours dark with low tanned head
Aromas of liqourize, coffee, black malts, dark fruits, nuts, 
Taste has notes of caramel, dark fruits, liqourize, chocolate, coffee, brown sugar
Mouthfeel is medium bodied, low to medium bitterness, low carbonation, low to medium sweetness
From bottle. Pours opaque black, dark toffee head. Chocolate orange, coffee grind, toffee aromas. Full bodied, spicy and marzipan on the palate.

Bottle. Pours dark brown, black with a small, stylish, mocha-colored head. Aroma is a lot of roast, slight smoke, some liquorice, dark fruits. Slight earthiness. Taste is trong roast, slight liquorice, chewy and mouth-filling. Slight smoke, earthiness, lactose. Full with good carbonation.

Pours deep black with medium brown head. Nose is roasted malts. Aromas are roasted malts, dark chocolate, dark fruits, licorice, miky notes. Low carbonation, medium body. Medium bitter and sweet milky finish. Really tasty and enjoyable.

Bottle at Appellation Wines tasting. Dark brown body with a thin beige head. Good lacing. Aroma of dark chocolate, fig and stewed fruit. Flavour of liquorice, marzipan and more dark chocolate. Medium body with a smooth, creamy mouthfeel. Soft fizz. A fantastic beer - complex and very drinkable.
Bottle at appellation. Pours black, nose is chocolate, berries, cola, taste is sweet toffee, chocolate, light fruit.
Comely Bankers III. Dark brown. Nose is sweet liquorice, light roast, dark chocolate. Tastes liquorice, even slight salted liquorice, sweet chocolate, light roast. Good.
Bottle thanks to BenH. Tonnes of dark chocolate. Creamy chocolate on the taste. Liquorice. Smoke. Lovely.
En rigtig porter, lakrids og humle. Stor fylde gør at den er næsten er et måltid i sig selv.

A brilliant beer. Pours dark black with brown foam. Nose - burnt toast, toffee. Taste is sweet and balanced bitterness. Burnt toast, toffee, coffee, chocolate. Medium carbonation and very Balanced alcohol love it...
Farven er mørk mahognibrun til sort med en lysebrun fast skumkrone. Aromaen og smagen er kaffe (meget kaffe), chokolade, karamel og lakrids.

Pours dark brown with light brown head with medium retention. Aroma of roasted malt, toffee and caramel. The sweetness from the aroma is also reflected in the taste, whre licorice and coffee joins the malt and caramel. Sweeter that I would expect from a porter with a quite thick texture and soft carbonation. Aftertaste again sweet - almost sticky - with a little bitterness kicking in. OK porter, but too one-dimensional and sweet to rate with the best..

Aroma of chocolate, liquorice, roasty, caramel. Black with brown semi-long lasting foam. Medium-heavy sweetness followed by light bitterness. Long lasting taste. Full body, creamy comfortable texture, soft carbonation. A very well brewed ported.

Bottle @ eskes, Vejle. Served too cold. Aroma of roasted malt, liquorice. Black colour with tan head, mostly lasting. Taste is moderate malt bitterness, light+ sweetness, little metal. Full body, oily texture, avg. carb., malt bitter finish.

The aroma is sweet, and not so dark as it looks. caramel, herbs, barnyard, banana, 

Its black, even the tiny foam on top is dark.black, cloudy, brown foam,

Its taste is not simple but full, with room for different tastes. medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, salty, 

medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

Continuous light brown foam. Light aroma of English licorice, hard toasted malt and coffee. The taste is malty and far sweeter than expected for a porter. Long pleasant malty aftertaste of coffee and licorice. Fine porter.

Bottle shared thanks to HenrikSoegaard. Pours near black with a short lived beige head. Aroma of coffee, roast, toffee, caramel, dark chocolate and a little licorice. Flavour is over moderate sweet and bitter. Moderate thick mouthfeel. Over medium bodied with soft carbonation. Decent.

33cl bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis.
Thin tan head. Clear deep amber pour. Really enjoyable
33cl bottle. Bought in Rema 1000. Dark brown body, medium creamy foam. Chocolate or coffee aroma. Tasty. Coffee in flavor. Good.
Traded with Jan, thanks. Black ruby, clear, light brown foam head, vanished after a while. Chocolate aroma and bitter chocolate taste. Great drink. (Velp 201508)

33cl bottle @ hotel room, Ribe. Poured black with a thick creamy espresso head. Licorice, ash, roasted malt, dark chocolate in aroma. Flavor has dark chocolate, tobacco, sweetness, cocoa. Pleasant roast. Very tasty.
Bottle at James 10k tasting. Pours a deep black with a thin tan head. Roast and cocoa on the nose. Medium bodied, thick roast, cocoa. Long roast into the finish, chocolate and cocoa.
Bottle at home. Pours black with a dense beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, coffe, licorice, choko. Taste is the same, very pleasent and well balanced with notes of alcohol.

Bottle courtesy of Ramy at Clockworks 10K tasting, April 19th 2015. Pours a deep black body with no head, light brown bubbles. Mouthfeel is medium with notes of rich earthy wood, sweet chocolate candy, earthy dirt, sweet deep roast, branches, and almost a sweet lactose character. This was really good and an awesome representation of what I envision a Baltic Porter should be.
Bottle at 10k tasting. Deep dark beer with a rich nose of chocolate and cola. Tastes of cola, chocolate, red fruit, roasted malt, some bitterness. Pretty lovely.
Bottle at 10K. Pours dark brown tan head. Nose/taste of brownie, toasted chocolate, caramel and light oxidation. Medium body.
Bottle. Black pour with tan head. Roasted, dark malt aromas. Herbal, roasted, chocolate and dark tones.

Bottle @ Home. Pours dark brown with a light brown head. Aroma roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, licorice. Flavor is malty, caramel, coffee, dark chocolate, licorice, some dark dried fruit, berries, some alcohol. Medium body, oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Some warming alcohol. 140910
Bottle. Black color, brown color. Aroma: chocolate, toast, vanilla some plums. Really nice smell. Flavor: coffe, nuts and dark fruits. Full body. On malty side. Overall: almost perfect.

Copenhagen 31/1 2015. 33 cl bottle from Rema 1000. Pours black with big dark beige head. Slowly subsiding. Aroma is sweetish - chocolate, nuts and a little coffee. Medium carbonation. Taste is bittersweet. Actually rather more bitter than sweet. The pronounced taste hides the high alcohol content quite well. Ok - but a bit one-dimensional.
En dejlig fyldig øl, som smager lidt sødere og bedre end mange andre portere.

33cl bottle. dark brown, almost black colour, opaque. dark beige head. fine lacing aroma of roasted malts, coffee and dark chocolate. black coffee and dark chocolatein taste, nice bitter finish. well-hidden alcohol. medium to low carbonation. quite good.

330 ml bottle, courtesy of Nils, shared at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Black color with beige head. Roasted malty aroma, chocolate, light fruity. Sweet and bitter taste, roasted malty again and chocolate. Medium oiy body with soft carbonation.

Black body, dark beige head with red small tones, many fine laceworks.
Aroma; sweet coffee malts, liquorice, anise, black caramel, dark brunost, dusty hops.
Taste; cocoa, mocca, black caramel, coffee-sugar, candied hops, roasted sweet malts, all on a fine backbone of bitter juice. Finishes with some warmth, sweet-bitter dark tastes, black chocolate, dusty liquorice aso. Tasty and full bodied. 
 [33cl bottle, 8.2%abv, BB16.10.18]
Bottle. Color black with small head. Aroma roasted, chocolate. Taste sweet, roasted, chocolate, dry.

Bottle from Voldby. Pours black with a brown head. Aroma is roasted malts and coffee. Roasted malty taste, dark chocolate, coffee. Oily texture. Nice smooth mouthfeel. Soft carbonation. Slight bitter roasted finish. Quite good.

Drinking from a 33 cl bottle. 
In the aroma I have chocolate and coffee. 
The unclear black beer has a medium brown head. 
Roast malt, dark chocolate, spices in the taste. 
High carbonated.

Bottle thanks to Zakoon. Pours a pitch black color with a medium brown colored head. A big ashy chocolate nose. The flavor is huge metallic roast, chocolate, nutty, huge vanilla. The overwhelming metallic roast is lovely. Some Guinness FES versions have this as well as some aged American Imperial Stouts like Stone RIS and Expy. Soft cocoa and metal in the finish. Damn good.
Sort som natta med et rødbrunt skum. Aroma av røstet malt, kaffe, sjokolade og frukt. Smaken følger aroma, søtlig smak med fint innslag av mørk fruk og en fin fylde.

0.33l bottle. Pours very dark brown with a small but persisting, creamy, tan brown head and some lacing. The nose is yeasty, in the mouth it has a medium aroma of roasted malts, with some nuts and maybe a hint of licorice but really not much else. The taste is very well balanced between sweetness and bitterness. Very smooth, creamy, full-bodied palate. Nice and smooth, but without much aromatic character.

Bottle. Pours opaque black with medium coffee brown foamy head. Aroma is roasted malt, prunes, apples, sweet licorice, black coffee hints of yoghurt and grassy hops. Taste is light sweet, medium to very bitter, light to medium sour and light umami and very faint salty. Body is milky with light fizzy carbonation. Finish is very long and mostly bitter with notes of malt, licorice, soy sauce, cough drops, chalk and gravy. Excellently rich, complex and balanced!
Shared with McTapps. Thick and dark with slight sourish background, some milk, coffee and malt. Easy going and easy drinkable with a slightly bitter end. Would have taken a second one.

Bottle from trade with Bamsen78 - thank you a lot, Marcin! The beer pours out in a deep black colour with brown steady creamy head and smooth body. Aroma of raosted toast, malt and coffee. Taste of coffee, dark chocolate, toast, roast, woods, torf and vanilla. Hints of caramel. Creamy texture. Smooth and delicious to drink, enjoyed it.

Black body with a medium brown, long-lived head that settles as a fully lasting layer that knows how to decorate a glass with lacing. Very strong aroma that is, not surprisingly, heavy malty. I get lots of roasted notes of dark coffee, dark caramel and coffee. In addition there are dark berries, leather in the back and traces of soy sauce. Strong flavour that feels even more dark roasted than the aroma, with strong coffee in front. In addition there is warming alcohol and dark berries in the back. Moderate sweet taste with a long-lasting, quite heavy bitter finish. The bitterness is a bit too sharp, and is accompanied by hints of malty sourness. Close to full-bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very good imperial stout, and for the price its a bargain. 
[33 cl bottle, enjoyed 4 years before BB date, from Spar Lønstrup, Jylland, Denmark]
Bottle. Pitch black pour with tan/light brown head. Aroma has lots of liquorice and roasted malt. Taste has burnt coffee and caramel. Lovely bitterness.

Bottle from a Copenhagen supermarket. Poured a deep mahogany with a thin frothy tan head. The aroma is rich roasted malt, chocolate, caramel and some red-berry fruit. The flavour is strong bitter with a dry earthy mineral chocolate coffee malt palate. Medium to full bodied with soft carbonation. A real find!

Flaska. Nästan helt svart med givmilt moccafärgat skum. Dofter av säd, karamell, mörk choklad och kaffe. Smakinslag av mörk choklad, soja, lakrits, kaffe och rostad malt. Sältan är underbar. Mjuk beska. Alkoholen är inte det minsta framträdande. Mycket gott.
0,33l bottle from Irma, Fredriksberg. Pours pitch black with a low tan head. Aroma is roasted malts with some coffee and alcohol. Flavor is roasted malts, coffee, alcohol and hops. Great.

Roasted licorice. Heavy mouthfeel astringent but bitterness rules this ancient brew. Solid.

Shared bottle at Cardinal. Pours black with a small tanned head. Aroma is dark malty, liquorice, inviting. Light creamy and oily mouthfeel. Taste is moderate roasted, lovely dark malts, lingering moderate sweet malty.

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2015 Black with small light tan head. Aroma has licorice, tar and light smoke. Bittersweet, salty licorice flavour, tar and light meaty smoke. Noticable but well balanced alchohol. Solid brew.

Black colour, beige head. Aroma of malts, apple and caramel. Bitter flavour, roasted malts, burned sugar, light sweet note. Finish roasted malts, caramel, apple and yeast. Bit disappointing, but the bottle was opened already for a while before I got to drinking it. Not long enough to expect it to go bad, but maybe it warrants a re-rate.
(From 33cL bottle @ ZZT VIIIb, Oirschot 2013. Thanks for sharing, joes!)

Bottle, from Sjøbeck Øl & Vand, thanks so much to Hanne for accommodating, or else Id find it difficult to taste this beauty, which is not likely to be imported into New Zealand that soon. Oily black, fascinating stuff, with a brown bubbly head. I almost poured it onto myself. The aroma was a bit too leathery, with plenty of olives and coffee from the start. But from the glass, it was much more benevolent, with dark chocolate and liquorice. Delicious flavours all well woven together, with the typical strong liquorice, the dark chocolates, some smokiness, tobacco and prunes. Very smooth and sweet, somehow like the well-behaved Carnegie and the Sinebrychoff, but with a nice bitterness hanging above the melange, a more savage facet making itself more evident on the long finish. I love the sticky texture, oily and creamy. A lovely experience. I dont know if the Danish Department of tourism realises that, but it is due to such beers that I will book a trip to Danmark next year.
Zzt13 bij joes. Ruikt en smaakt zoet, drop, koffie, caramel, mooi in evenwicht. Lekker.
Thanks to Joes. Pours a black beer with a creamy tan head. Smells glue, coffee, and roasty. Tastes coffee, glue and roasted with a good bitter finish. Medium body, sticky texture and a low carbo.

Flaske 33 cl
Flot mørk brun farve med lysebrunt skum, smagen er meget lakrids og karamel. En meget dejlig porter.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
& via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours cloudy very dark brown with airy but stable tan head. Clear aroma of malt, caramel and roast. Sweetish, malty flavour with pronounced notes of roast, dark chocolate and caramel. A hint of liquorice in the bitter, roasty aftertaste. Creamy mouthfeel. Nice.

Bottle at Borefts 13, thanks to Kraddel for sharing, 28/09/13.
Light black with a thin tan head.
Nose carries slightly oxidised note, dark malt, cocoa, earthy.
Taste comprises earthy notes, cocoa powder, dark toffee.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, light roast in the finish.
Alcohol fairly well disguised but lacks depth for a Baltic porter.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
pours black ,small grey foam . smells OK 
much, but soft carbo . very sweet, portertaste . tastes a bit dusty . some smoked malts ?

Courtesey & thx! to Kraddel. Bottle sampled @ Borefts 2013. BBF 12/05/2018. Chocolate black, little mocha head. Nose is oxidized, smells old, oily nuts, old chocolate, some dust, Taste is oily, nuts, bitter metallic, malty, bitter roast & roots, touch medicinal finish, chocolate, thicker chocolate, lasting bitter finish. Very oily mouthfeel. Nicer than, that descriptions sounds like.
Bottle @ borefts 13. Quite black with a small off white head. Smells roasty, chocolate, liquorice, earthy. Tastes roasty, chocolate, ash, tar, liquorice. Medium body, low carbo, slightly silky.

Sampled from bottle thanks to Kraddel. Opaque pitch black color, small tan head. Strong aroma of malts and coffee. Taste malts, roasted malts, lots of coffee. Strong roasty chocolate bitter finish. Medium body and carbonation.

33 cl bottle. Pitch black color. Dense brown head with good retention. Aromas: sweet chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, a bit vanilla. Mocha, roast & sweet coffee retronasal. Flavor is moderate sweet, roasted, coffee. Body is on the thin side for the strength & style. Finishes with heavy roast & ash. I was suprised to find out this is from Carlsberg because it was excellent, at least for an industrial beer. A bit more body would do it even more good.

330 ml bottle. 323. BB 28/01/14. (Superbest) Copenhagen, Denmark.
Black colour with a small fast disappearing bubbly tan head. 
Sweetness, mild coffee, milk chocolate, hot chocolate, some malt and mild bitterness in the aroma. 
The flavour is roasted malt, soy sauce, bitterness, dark chocolate, some sweetness and mild dryness. 
Rather nice and tasty. Very good one for the price less than 10 kroner (2009).
bottled, thanks to kim for sharing. quite robust flavours and aromas - cocoa powder, licorice, vanilla and stone fruits; thick but still easy drinking

UPDATED: SEP 29, 2013 Bottle, shared with Mathieu87.
APPEARANCE: pitch black beer, small beige unstable head.
NOSE: whiskey, molasses, alcohol, coffee, chocolate, liquorice. 
TASTE: very easy drinking porter, somewhat smoked, little watery maybe, some faint alcohol noticeable at the end.

Many thanks Ignace!
Re-rate at Borefts, THX Kraddel for sharing!
Adapted the score a little.

33 cl flaske, 8,2 %, 26. juni 2013.
Kaffe-aroma og sort/brunt øl i glasset er det første møde med ca. 2 cm brunt/beige skum. Skummet minimeres efter et par minutter.
En cremet ølsmag fylder munden og der er tale om en anelse sødme i starten. Der afsluttes med god bitterhed. En øl, hvorom man roligt kan sige: Value for money!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Fra flaske på Cardinaltreff juni-13: myk, avrundet - en deilig porter, men uten det lille snertet av kreosot og skipstrosser som klassikeren Limfjordsporter har. Fantastisk lettdrikkelig for sitt høye vitamininnhold. Må kjøpes neste gang jeg er i Dronningens by, men er redd for at denne er vanedannende (men nå i en alder av 60 det er kanskje bare sunt).
UPDATED: FEB 10, 2014 Dark brown, malty and slightly sour aroma, cigar box. Taste of darks malts. A decent dark beer.

33cl bottle. Pours pitch black with small  offwhite head. Aroma is malty toasted and toffie liqourice. Taste is strong english liquorice, sweety followed by bitterness from roasted malts and hops.  Is is a strong beer with balancedflavours.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pour is pitch black with very little chestnut brown head and quite a few bubbles. Nose is nice, fair amount of chocolate, hint of anise, slight roast coffee bean.  Taste is much sweeter, sugar galore, berry, sweet caramel, light anise, roast is gone. Not good. Thin body, light carb, bitterness lingers.
Thanks Denmark! Enjoyed in aTeku glass. dark black with a 2 finger coffee head. Nose is very clean. Yeasty with dark chocolate. Very roasty taste, moldy basement a bit but nice finish.
Bottle from Dedollewaitor. Jet black with a caramel head. Sweet roasted malt aroma. Flavour is peat, blackberry, roasted creamy on a dry ash smoke finish. Palate is burnt malt. Lovely
330 ml bottle, rated from backlog. Aroma of raisins, roasted malt, alcohol and sweet dark sugars. Taste is fairly dry, boozy. Tasty

Bottle. Nice black porter...looks right. Definite taste of malt, licorice and coffee. Mouthfeel is medium+ and aftertaste is malty and pleasant. Nothing out of the ordinary but a really good "safe" beer - especially for the money.

Bottle. Pours very dark brown with a fizzy, minimal and partly lasting light brown head. Aroma is licorice, medium malty, toffee, raisins, bread, coffee,spice, dark berries,  honey, grassy hops, soy and a tiny vinous note. Taste is medium sweet and light+ bitter. Body is medium+, texture is oily near thick, carbonation is soft. Finishes dry malty and a little boozy. Amazing bang for the buck.

Black with small light brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, vanilla, raisins, prunes. Taste is vinous with dried dark fruits and mild roast. Soft and sweet, a bit watery towards the finish but turns dry and slight bitter.
Det var kanske lite dumt, men jag hade inga större förväntningar på den här ölen. Men den var rätt bra med en stabil kropp, smaken var kanske lite hård och spretig men den var god ändå.
Pours black with a tan head. Aroma is sweet and has notes of chocolate, licorice, caramel and roasted malts.

21/07 RBESG Grand Tasting, 0.33 l bottle. It poured very dark brown body with smaller brown head. Roasted malt aroma, lot of raisins, caramel, licorice, lactic. Sweet but also sharp bitter flavor, quite typical for the style, overripe fruits, raisins, licorice, touch of metal. Medium in body with long, pleasant finish that also showed some lactic acidity besides the ordinary things. Quite good Baltic porter, although I still havent found an excellent one.

330ml bottle. Courtesy of Papsoe. Coffe and dark chocolate aromas, very intense. Pours very dark, oily, with dense tan head, persistent, some lacing. Full bodied. Taste is roasty, some raisins, bitter cocoa. Enjoyable.
Dark brown, small creamy tab head. Creamy Porter, blackberry, chocolate. Medium full body and smooth drink. Bitter base, nice flavor. Better than expected. Fine brew.

RBESG 2012 Grand tasting. Dark brown colour, almost black. Aroma peat, toasted, raisins, fruity. Taste caramel, smooth, medium sweet and medium bitter. Very drinkable. Finish bitter-sweet, a bit tart.
RBESG Grand Tasting. Black color with beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, red fruits. Taste, coffee, roasted malt, dark chocolate, licorice caramel. Long coffee bitter finish. Good.

330 ml bottle received as a birthday present by rlgk. Many thanks! Pours pitch black with a creamy milk chocolate brown head that slowly dissipates while clinging to the glass and leaving some thick lacing. Smell is sweet and fruity with burnt caramel, prunes, chocolate, alcohol, dark grapes, rubber, dark bread, asphalt, wood, fudge, brown sugar and hints of sweetened coffee and vanilla. Taste is sweet and bitter with bitter chocolate, darkly roasted coffee, dark grapes, plums, dark bread, caraway, salty liquorice, rubber, tar, ash, alcohol, wood and hints of banana bread and honey. Mouthfeel is smooth, slightly dry, tiny tart, tiny boozy and medium to full bodied. Finish is tiny sweet and bitter with dark bread, rubber, salty liquorice, coffee and bitter chocolate.

[5/12/12] Bottle sample at Ølfestival København 2012. Black-colored with a light brown head. Classic roasty-malty Baltic Porter aroma with some alcohol and a bit of licorice. Sweet alcholic flavor with malt, roastiness, some dark fruits notes and a drier roasty finish with a light herbal hint. Medium-full-bodied. Not my thing, but quite OK.

Bottle 33cl from Henrick Papsoe thanks a lot, a dark beer with huge brownish head. Nose is creamy like, bitter dark chocolate like and licorice notes. Aroma is deep on roasted, coffee, dark chocolate, licorice, some over riped fruit notes, metallic hints at the finish. A nice creamy porter, not too complex.

Pour opaque dark, nearly black, with a big frothy tan head. 
Aroma is quite roasted, slight toast and bread. 
Taste is classic roasted and bitter. 
Smooth on the palate, with a medium body, and some lively carb. going on
Bottle 33 cl. Light roasted aroma, nice brownish head. Roasted taste of liquorice and roasted malts. Alc is easily disguised.

33 cl bottle. Rated on 12.10.2009
Very dark colour, some light comes through at the sides of the glass. Thin and long-lasting head. Flavour reminds me of anchor porter with sweet chocolate, some cocoa and hints of coffee. Flavour has rye pudding, some sweet chocolate and hints of metal. Palate is surprisingly thin.
black, tan foam, clear, chocolate, coffee, smoke, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation,
black, clear, brown foam, smoke, coffee, chocolate, roasty, full body, creamy, average carbonation, bitter, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness,
Thnx to the best viking of them all. Black colored brew. Roasted aroma, coffee. Flavor is salty, roasted malts, burned, coffee. Very bitter. Nice!

Bottle: Thanks to Sfhodense:
Medium vast brown head on top of a black beer.
Looks like an Imperial Stout.
Smell dark fruit like prunes, raisin, brown sugars, hint of liquorice, slighter hint of coffee and slightest hint of burned wood.
Taste dark and red fruit, prunes, strawberry and banana, spicy, some alcohol, roasted malts, medium bitter, hint of sweets and a slight hint of coffee.
Dark fruity bitter light coffee-ish aftertaste.
Low carbo, soft light tingly/spicy mouthfeel, medium to full body and a light watery texture. Decent beer.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Black with a lasting brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, dark chocolate and a little smoke. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. For an industrial brew its fantastic. 100911

UPDATED: NOV 14, 2013 Aroma is roasty malt, coffee, quite baltic.
Flavour is deep roasty, malty, coffee baltic goodness.
Nice one Carlsberg.

(33 cl bottle from Knud Bahr) Pours pitch black with thick, toffee head that laces the glass heavily. Aroma is tar, licorice, smoke with hints of vegetal hops. Texture is creamy, full-bodied, softly carbonated with a long, sweet and dry finish. Taste is well balanced, gentle sweetness counterbalanced by a moderate hop bitterness with toasted malt notes.
Black pour, tan head. Aroma of roasty malts, a fireplace and shoepolish. Flavor is bitter roasted with a slight sweetness and some spices. Slightly rough, and a bit strange, but very nice.

Dunkler, voluminöser röstmalziger Antrunk. Der Mittelteil baut direkt darauf auf, indem er das Aroma aufgreift und einen leicht herb-getreidigen Teil hinzufügt. Im Nachgeschmack scheint die Intensität sich zu verdoppeln, man wird von malzige, röstmalzigen und nussigen Aromen geradezu bebombt. Dies geschieht allerdings nur kurz, danach klingt der Geschmack langsam ab. Die 0,33l Flasche reicht hier aufgrund der Intensität des Bieres sehr lange, mir gefällts. 	 
Test vom 7.8.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 10,11,9,13,6,12 - 11,05

Wow, what a body! Dense, oily, big! Pours with a nice head, darker than ecru and small, but which lasts as a ring and is easily revived. Deep, rich aroma of bitter chocolate, stewed plum and butter, raisin, some charred roastiness. Tastes like burnt roasty buttered raisins that had been reduced during cooking, with some kind of herbal accompaniment (Rosemary stalks?). Not as vinous and winey and fruity as the best Polish BPs, which are quite good, but this has a lovely roastiness that really keeps your interest. Challenging stuff, thanks to Papsoe for the bottle. The way the superfine carbonation clings to the glass as you drink it shows the most excellent conditioning.
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text: At last - the elusive Wiibroe Porter Imperial Stout is mine, as rating #3000. 330 ml bottle, at Plan B, Copenhagen. Black colour, moderate creamy tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, caramel, coffee, chocolate and liquorice, hints of oak and dark dried fruits. Roasty flavour, dark malts and coffee, hints of liquorice and dark chocolate. Lovely!

Bottle, 33cl. Pours a clear and black beer with a beige head. The aroma is malt, chocolate, roasted and notes of fruit. The flavor is following the nose with additional slate. The palate is dry with some sweetness. Overall a good beer.
A must taste for anyone who loves dark, dark beer. A wonderfull taste of coffee, chocolate, roast and caramel spreads throughout your mouth with every sip you enjoy.
Pours black with a beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, liquorish, chocolate, coffee and fruity notes. Flavour is roasted malt, liquorish, chocolate and a stony note.

Fine lasting brown head god laces 
Nose with light fruit, a little cardboard, not so intense
Fullbodies, and fine length, quite bitter
Bitter chockolate, dryish
Dissapointing as i find it a bit onedimensional.
UPDATED: FEB 10, 2012 Pours black in black, with dark brown foam. Roasted coffe and chocolate aroma. Massive roasted aroma with chocolate, coffe and bitterness. Great beer indeed.

0,33 l. bottle from the supermarket.  I looked forward to this one: The highest rated "Carlsberg" on RB, even higher than some of their ridiculously expensive "Vintage" beers. Almost jet black colour, small and stable brown head. Dark and roasted malts in the quite distinctive alcoholic nose. Very robust bitter-sweet flavour, full body, hints of chocolate, roasted, malty finish. At just 10 DKK/1,30 EUR: Excellent price - taste ratio!

Bottled. Pours opague blak with a brown glow and a creamy, light brown head. Nose of slightly roasted malt. Good lacings. Medium sweet flavour with coffee, bread and tar notes. Flat carbontion. Creamy texture. Full bodied. A smooth imperial stout with great value for the money.

Extremely black with fine brown head that settles fairly quickly as a thin cap over the toasted, roasted aromas of malt, coffee, port wine (raisins?) and smoke. The taste is fuller than the smell might imply, but the combination of licorice-like notes, roasted malts, smoke and dried fruits (raisins, again ..) is very harmonious, smooth and successful. A really nice beer, with a fine tuned bitter finale.

Flaske 33 cl. Sort hælde med lysebrun hoved af middel til kort holdbarhed. 
Aroma og smag af ristet eller nærmere brændt malt og brun farin med noter af tjære eller tobak. Tør mundfornemmelse og en bitter afslutning

Pours a dark brown color with a thin tan head.  Aroma of dried fruit, soy sauce, smoke and chocolate.  Flavor is roasty and a bit tart, with notes of nuttiness, chocolate and fruit coming through.  Nice.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2012 Pours clowdy black with small dark brown head. Malty, roasted and hoppy aroma.  Medium body, acidy tary mouthfeel. Flavor of tar, malts and a bit fruits nicely sweet snd balanced. Finishes fruity tart hoppy.

rerated 120511 in Copenhagen @ Axelborg Bodega

Green bottle poured a clear dark brown with a lastring creamy tan head. Aromas of roated malt, licorice, prunes, figs and bitter chocolate./ Palate was medium to full bodied and smooth. Flavors of roasted malt, licorice, prunes, raisins and bitter chocolate with a smooth lingering fruity licorice finish.

Bottle 330ml @ home
Pours black with a tan head. Aroma is sweet and has notes of chocolate, licorice, caramel and roasted malts. Taste is light sweet and light bitter. Texture is oily with soft carbonation.
Fra flaske, dufter lidt af rosin dejligt af kaffe karamel, flot sort farve med brunt medium skum, smager frugt, rosin og kaffe, lidt tynd men ok fylde, i alt en ok til prisen Baltic Porter.
33cl, Danish brew, Gift from Secret Santa!, complex Porter, yet very easy to drink, balanced, hazy, small head, good brew, thx Santa!

Bottle from Papsoe I think...? Been sitting on it for a while so looked forward to finally sampling. Rich nose, dark malts a hint of liqourice and tobacco. Presents very well and drinks even better. Well balanced, rich dark malts, not too bitter if fact quite rich thru the mid palate, the alcohol strength is hidden and the finish long but not overpowering. Best beer Ive had for a long time....
Clear black body and a small diminishing light brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, tar, brown sugar and warming alcohol. Bitter finish, creamy and sticky. Heavy sweet and medium bitter.

(bottle, 33cl) Pitch black colour with a beige and short creamy layer. Roasty malty aroma with caramel, a touch of dried fruits and alcohol. Bitter and slightly sweet flavour; roasty and slightly burnt malty taste with notes of dark chocolate and mocha; quite dry and bitter roast-malty finish with pleasant notes of chocolate and coffee in the lasting aftertaste. 07.V.07
dark bread,chocolate, coffee, lakrids,black, brown foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, salty, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, nice beer.
Carlsberg, for denne ene øl er i tilgivet alt det rævepis i brygger. Pours almost black. Powerful coffee aroma; malt, hops, coffee, caramel flavour. Beautiful. Eminently drinkable.

(33cl bottle best by 1-28-14 thanks to blutt59) clear very dark brown with a dark tan head. Nose of brown sugar, sweet grain, fudge and mild alcohol. Taste of dark bakers chocolate, fudge, cola, light burnt grain, coffee and cream and lactose. Creamy finish. Reminds me of the flavor of creme brulee crust.
bottle, thanks to SS, black color with vinous , burnt chocolate aromas, flavors of chocolate, some chalk , smoked meat, char ash, nice finish

Thanks to blutt59 for sharing this bottle.

The beer pours  a dark brown to black color with red highlights and a tan head. The aroma is burnt and heavily roasted malt with some sugary notes. The flavor is burnt malt, smoke and sugar. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

Thanks Blutt59 for this one!
Sweet sugary smell.  Tastes smoky, maybe like the teriyaki chicken that I burned tonight.  The veins in my teeth is throbbing.  Must be good!!

0.33L bottle from Superbrugsen, Nykøbing Sj. Tall fine-bubbled light brown head. Good laceworks.  Body is black with a mahogny shade when holding it against the light. Dry, roasted and cocoa-ish malt aroma. Notes of dark dried fruits, bitter chocolate and coffee ground.  Medium strong malt body.. Dry and roasted with cocoa and bittter chocolate. Well prononced dusty and grassy hop bitterness. Medium full, chalky texture. Malty bitter and roasty end. Solid and tasty.

01-AUG-2010, bottle @home, from "Superbest".
Very dark brown with light brown head.
Wonderfull smoked nose with just a hint of alcohol.
Taste is very roasted with again the smoke shining through. Hoppy bitterness ends the taste.
Fanstasti beer for 8 DKK. This is up with many porters five or ten times the price. Really complex, long aftertaste, and a beer for men:-)

Pours a red-ish near-black body with a medium caramel-hued foamy top, lasting for a while. Smell is cocoa and chocolate roasted malts, with hints of coffee and booze. Taste is more cellar-ish: leather, earth and deep chocolate tones with hints of coffee. Pretty regular mouthfeel. This is a rather straightforward affair; damn solid Danish industrial craftsmanship but nothing really outstanding.

Bottle.

Pours dark brown with a shortlasting brown head.

Coffe, rosted malt and some chocolate.
Big bodied and probably one of the best value for money beers in the world.

6th June 2010. RBESG 10 Grand Tasting at the Brasserie 4:20 warehouse. Very dark brown beer. Ligh tan head. Light soft palate. Sweetish dark malt, a little chocolate and cream. Finishes with some minerals. Not bad at all!
chocolate, coffee, black, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, thick feel, long finish,

Bottle at RBESG Rome Grand Tasting. Black colour, brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, sweet. Flavour is sweet, malty, chocolate cake, light roasted finish. Medium bodied. Too sweet for my taste to be really good.

Bottled 330ml. -trade with faroeviking (thanks Jacob). Somehow managed to forget to rate this one earlier. Deep black coloured, medium sized brown head, malty chocolate nose with hint of smoke. Roasted malt, dark chocolate and some licorice with discreet notes hops near the finish. Quite oily. Very pleasant brew.

Dark, almost black pour with a lightly tanned head. Aroma of alcohol, sweet malts, dark fruits, slight hops and some berries along with hints of lemon. Sweet taste of malt, berries, some roast and chocolate along with a little coffee. Smooth and well-balanced. Oily palate, medium carbonation, long duration.

Bottle that ogivlado got in a trade with faroeviking and shared with me (thanks!) Poured an almost opaque black body with a brown-tan head. Dark malts dominate the nose hand in hand with raisins and alcohol, very light chocolate, slightly sourish. Dry roasty taste, sweet, some burnt chocolate, ash. Slightly yoghurty and oily. Not too bad, a good lighter IS.
330ml Bottle (Thanks Faroeviking) - Black with a tan head. Malty aroma with notes of plain chocolate. Chocolate and malty taste with roasted malt and hints of marzipan and liquorice.

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2010 Rating #303, bottle from Skjold Burne at Kongens Nytorv, Copenhagen   

This beer is a completely black fellar with a yellow, dense head. The appearance gives a nice impression, but unfortunately this is not the case with the aroma. The aroma is rather metallic and sour, but has some tar and chocolate too. The flavor is as well dissapointing. It is marked by chocolate and sweet liqourice at first, but then it becomes sour, alcoholic and very metallic. The finish is only easily bitter. The beer is thick and soft.  

This beer was originally retired in 2004, when Carlsberg after having bought Wiibroe Brewery, decided to shut down the production in Elsinore. However, the people and beer enthusiasts of Denmark insisted of getting this claimed magnificent porter back on the market, and in 2008 it arrived again.  

I have never understood the hype about this beer, as it is not that special or magnificent. I have bought several specimens to be sure, that the taste is supposed to be as I have rated it, but unfortunately it is.   Maybe the hype is originated in the fact that around the time for this beers retirement, Denmark had really not seen the wave of specialty beers hit yet. Therefore, this beer might be remembered as a special beer for its time, and better than it actually was. 2.8 points.  

26.11.10, re-tasting at free beer tasting at Hatten Bar  

Finally I got a Wiibroe Porter that tasted as it was supposed to. Thank you. This was a black beer with a brown hue, but only unstable head. Aroma was obvious with chocolate and coffee, and flavor had a lot of liquorice, coffee, chocolate, and even the cheese-like flavor I always hope to find in these strong porters. Very nice. Alcohol was not as powerful as the earlier examples of the beer I have had, and the hops were correctly powerful. Furthermore, the beer felt creamy and soft in mouth. Finally a Wiibroe Porter that makes me understand the re-introduction of the beer.

Bottle from Madsberg.  Pours a deep brown, fairly viscous with a 2 finger thick tan head, spotty lacing.   Nice nose of burnt chocolate, roasted malts and a touch of coffee.  Lingering cocoa notes on the palate, tasty.
33 cl bottle. Dark brown body with big tan head. Flavour is roasted malt, coffee and chocolate.

dak, the myth and the legend comes through with a big on on my wants list on 1/17/2010. bottle bb 3/13/2014.

poured into the duck rabbit snifter a chestnut-y dark brown with a soft tan head which lasts as a ring.

the aroma is initially tart... reminds me of slightly charred raisins... followed by high roast, teriyaki beef jerky (very meaty), brown sugar and faint chocolate or nutty notes.

the tartness makes its way into the flavor as well... along with raisins, molasses, charcoal, lager yeast-like stink/earthiness and some dark nearly burnt roast. the aftertaste is solidly ashy.

crisp, easy drinking texture and mouth feel with a medium body. neat-o beer... 7/4/8/4/16/3.9

Bottle. Pours almost pitch black, with only some light coming through in the bottom of the glass. A finger brown head, that generates some awsome lacing. Aromas of molasses, dried dark fruits like raisins, liqourice and some coffee. Flavours are roasted malts, charcoal, molasses, dired dark fruits especially raisins, and some dark chocolate. There is also a slight amount of hops traceable in the beer, but not much. Finishes of with coffee and some alcohol. Medium to full body, with a nice creamy texture. A beer that is worth checking out, especially because of what you get for a beer this cheap!

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2010 Black pour with a fine brown head.
The nose has a hint of coffee, som dark fruits like raisins and plums, cocoa and liquirice.
The taste has at first some roasted malts and the coffee, and after that the dark fruits take in along with some sweetness and a liquirice touch, ending with the coffee. A bit of hop is trackable in the aftertaste.
Considering the pirce, this is a really good beer. It also is if you dont. In the same league as the Limfjordsporter, and I might prefer this one.

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2010 Bottle from Dk. Nothing special here but a decent beer. Pours black with minimal tan head. Aroma of roasted malt. thin body and  taste of more roasty malt and clean finish. Easy drinking beer!
Bottle. Black with a nice beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, coffee, caramel, chocolate and liquorice.

Thanks to plovmand for this beauty! Almost a pitch black pour, tan head.  Nutty and roasty aroma loaded with chocolate, coffee and some tar.  Flavor is very roasty, a rich chocolate is kept in check with a nice roasted, bitter element.  Damn find stuff.  Damn fine.
Nice porter/stout with a classic taste with burned notes and dark character. Its rather generic, but well-crafted.
Bottle. Thanks Brian. Pours deep brown with a nice cappuccino coloured head. Aromas of sweet malt/sugar, chocolate, coffee and caramel. Flavours of licorice, sugar, coffee and caramel. Tasty brew!

Bottle. 
Pours dark brown/black with a big fluffy beige head. 
There is lots of chocolate in the nose along with notes of caramel and brown sugar. 
It has a strong sweet liquorice flavour with notes of chocolate, a little salt and a hint of coffee. 
Nice and full bodied.

Colore scuro; testa cremosa e  marrone.Aroma di malto tostato,crema di latte,Sapore di malto tostato, liquirizia, caramello,caffè,finale amaro.Molto ben realizzata.Piacevole.

Bottle, courtesy Papsoe. Pitch black pour, creamy tan coffee head, thick lacing. Raisin and roasted notes in the nose, toffee, some chocolate. Creamy chocolate flavors, caramel, raisin, some roasted coffee. Soft, chewy, creamy. Enjoyed it, as the rating indicates.

Bottle. Black colour with large creamy light brown mostly lasting. Aroma is roasted malt with notes of licorice.  Sweet flavor with notes of coffee.

Bottle at EBF copenhagen 2008 ... The one big dissapointment... I so wanted to like this as it was a good scoring Carlsberg beer, and sicne we were in the brewery for the festival felt i should have one Carlsberg beer... Deep black ... light malt nose ... roast malts but something else very odd ... didnt work at all for me.

Had this at the Plan B bar, Kobenhaven 13-09-08   Thi is a cool tasting smooth stout, bit edgey roasty and light burnt characteristics. This is quite a contrast to the Braunstein Black Oak Porter also tried at this bar.

Bottle courtesy of Gunhaver. Pours black with a one finger tan head that leaves good lacing. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, and chocolate. Taste is the same as aroma with tons of coffee up front. Medium full mouthfeel with a moderate amount of bitterness and smooth alcohol. Very good.

Courtesy of Geiger.
Pours black, with brownish head.
Tasate is roasted, coffee malts and grains. Some licorice, aftertaste goes down warm, and good alcohol content.
Could notice some fruit notes and roastiness.
I still see it as more of a strong baltic porter and not really an imp. stout.

Bottle (EBF2008)
Sweet coffee aroma. Some fruit. Sweeeeet palate, low carbonation. Over-ripe fruits in the taste, but good burntness. Maybe too sticky, but quite OK.

From Voldby, DK.
Bottled, 090908.
Dark reddish brown with brown head. Aroma of liqourice and smoke. Flavor of coffee, sweet malt and hints of dried fruit. Some alcohol

Black body with small tan head. Smokey, char and ash nose with some molasses and chocolate. The flavor is very sweet with lots of chocolate, molasses, prunes, roast and ash. Full body is round with moderate carbonation.

33 cl bottle. Pitch black colour with a small light brown head. Aroma of light smoke, roasted barley, also hints of coffee and vanilla. Oily palate with a soft mouthfeel  with some alcohol in the finish.

330 ml bottle courtesy of drewbeerme.  Pours black with a medium creamy tan head.  The aroma is chocolate, molasses, roasted malt, and a hint of dark fruit.  The flavor is dark chocolate, moderately sweet roasted malt, and a hint of coffee.  There is a bitterness that comes from the dark chocolate.  Creamy smooth drinking.

Bottle. Creamy lightbrown excellent mostly lasting head. Black colour. Powerfull chocolate and licorice aroma. Heavy licorice and smoke flavor. Long nice finish. Creamy palate.
1987 bottle tasted along: 7-3-7-4-16
Great stuff still. Vinius no head, lots of plumb and prunes notes. antastic experience.

(Bottle 33cl, from Nikolaj) Best before 09-2007. Pours pitch black with a medium light-brown head that mostly diminishes. Aroma of chocolate, coffee and roasted malt.  Sweet malty flavor with notes of dark chocolate, coffee and black pepper. Full bodied. Very good.

330 ml bottle. Pitch black. Tall beige fine-laced fluffy head. Sharply roasted malt aroma. Clean metallic hops and a delicate malty body. Quite bitter. Hints of pine. Nicely balanced. Definitely a lager.

Bottle 0.33 l. Bough Superbrugsen Ulleroed. Dark, dark brown colour with light brown soft head. Aroma roasted malts and a touch of dark bitter chocolate. Taste bitter with a hint of smoke. Medium, smooth body.  Almost at the same level as Limfjords Porter.

Bottle. Very dark almost black colour. Beige head. Aroma and taste of dark chocolate, roasted coffe, toffee and dark sugars. Roasted finish. Very very nice mouthfeel. Love it!

Appearance: Pours a dark brown, near black body with a tiny, short-lived tan head.

Smell: Scents of dark grains, unsweetened chocolate, and a grape-like fruitiness all wrapped up in a soil-covered earthiness.

Taste: Dark, and I do mean dark, maltiness with a taste of chocolate and a medium sugary sweetness. Touch of ground spices. Pretty well-balanced, complex and drinkable.
Pours a deep black color with a brown head.  Aroma is fruity, chocolate, roast, caramel, and toffee.  Flavor is chocolate, roast, fruit, and some alcohol.

Tasted 2008-02-20. Fresh bottle. Pours black with brown head. Aroma: First off, I get: Tar, liqourice, smoke and coffee. Then after a while that fades, and all I get is raisins/prunes. Very nice, but unexpected in a porter. Flavour: Moderately bitter, a little sweet/sour. Slightly salty. Very delicious! Full bodied. Amazing how much beer, you can get for 2 bucks!
Back with huge brown head. Aroma has roasted malt, bread and liquerice. Flavor is sweet with notes of roasted malt, liquerice, coffee and hops. Ends light bitter.

(Bottled, BBE 03/2008, thanks Timo A.!) Almost black with a medium, light brown, creamy and lacy, partly lasting head. Roasted-malty, salty-licoricey aroma with some milky sourness and black coffee. Creamy-silky, quite full-bodied, slightly sticky palate with pretty high, but smooth carbonation. A very pleasant and smooth Baltic Porter. The flavor lacks in complexity, but overall balance is great. Much easier to drink than Koff Porter.

Deep black in colour, long lasting creamy beige coloured head, excellent lacing.  The aroma is very roasty, lots of liquorice, moderate sweetness, dark chocolate, some coffee, light smoke.  The flavour is quite malty, roasty, chocolate, coffee and cream, moderately bitter, moderate sweetness, some noticable alcohol.  Sweet mouthfeel, medium/large body, medium/high carbonation. Finishes with some alcohol, lots of roast, some smoke.  This is pretty good, excellent roast throughout, nice smoke as well.  This is sweet but it never seems to overpower any aspect of the beer.
330ml bottle obtained in a trade with <a
href=http://www.ratebeer.com/ViewUser.asp?U target=blank>MPA, thanks Mads-Peter.
Opened on November 17, 2007.
Best before October 7, 2007.
Rating #1600.
Black colored. Has a lasting, beige head. Sweet, malty aroma, toast, burnt. Flavor is real heavy, burnt, soft. Palate is creamy, lasting.

Bottle from my (no longer) secret santa storm.  Thanks!  Pours black with a one-finger tan head that lasts.  Very nice looking danish beer with wonderful lace. Nose is fairly roasty, with some creamy milk chocolate, a hint of soy sauce, and some dark fruits. Very inviting aroma and appearance. Flavor is very well balanced with more cocoa, definite roasted coffee, a little salt, and a mild smokiness. Pretty thin mouthfeel considering the other aspects, but I dig it. Now idea how old this bottle is, but I from what I can decipher, the best by date is 8/27/07, so Im guessing at last a couple years old. Drinking this very fast as puzzl recommends and I really like it. Alcohol is very well hidden. A great beer experience.  Thanks again, Jacob!

Deep black pour with brown highlights and a thin light brown head. Aroma of soy sauce with sweetness. The mouth is dominated by the powerfull roasted malt, theres chocolate too and bitterness in the finish. The body is light with a vinous texture and soft carbonation.

330ml bottle (bb.18.03.08) picked up at Ølbutikken, Copenhagen some months ago. Presents itself with a dark brown, dense head with nice round dimples supported by good laceworks. Devil dark body. Dark cocoa to the nose plus a peaty touch. Sophisticated mocha malty taste followed by smooth roasted grain with some bitterness pushing through in the ending. Masked alcohol. Full bodied (29.12.2007).

Bottle from Theis. Big, salty, rich plummy aroma. Balanced and rich in the flavor, very smooth and creamy. Goes down very easy, but begins to fade a little as it warms. Id recommend drinking this one rather quick, but fresh out the bottle its awesome.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2015 bottle off the shelf, probably only few months old max.
wow. You could eat this for breakfirst. tastes like coffe, just much better. If you are into heavy beers, this one is not to miss. Tastes lots more than just the average low-cost beer. Im going to have a stash of these. its thick, the head looks real nice, not so high, very brown. Aftertaste is fantastic and lingers for long. Almost makes me wait for the next sip just to enjoy the feeling. The high alc adds power, but in a stylish way-  its not like the 8.2% is in the way, its just argumenting the intensity of it. Very dark beer. probably darker than coffee.
re-rate 2015.

aroma of roasted malts, coffee, faint caramel, quite complex aroma.

flavor is roasted malts, dark caramel, coffee, slightly weird herbal and hoppy bitterness, a very roasted malty and charred woody aftertaste,  This is pretty damn good for a macro. 8
overall 16

bottle thanks to Papsoe.  Pours a dark brown-black with thin, light brown head which dissipated almost immediately except around the rim.  Had some lacing.  The aroma was roast coffee with a hint  of cocoa.  Flavor is similar to the aroma with coffee and a hint of cocoa.  This is unlike many other imperials in that it is not as bold or harsh; lot smoother.  Mouthfeel is medium but coats the tongue and leaves a dry aftertaste.  Much more drinkable than many Impy stouts because of its smoothness.

Bottle, five years old. Gorgeous appearance. An opaque ultra-deep brown body is dusted with glowing crimson hints. A finely lacing head is tan, slowly diminishing and creamy. Smokey roasted grains lead in the nose, followed by heavy soy, matted greens and oxidation. This has developed into a really interesting reinterpretation of its former self. Coffee and roasted malts are full strength and suitably mask what seems it wopuld otherwise be hefty amounts of oxidation. The flavor is highly roasty, moderately bitter, lightly warming from alcohol, mildly sweet and lightly astringent. Finishes heavily roasty, with mild chocolate and scorched coffee lingering. Hops in the finish are still evident at this grand old age. The mouthfeel is jagged but drinkable. Very tasty. This seems like an intended blend of the subtle nuances of a traditional Baltic porter and the outlandish eccentricities of a proper, old-school English(original, Russian style) imperial stout.

Poured an opaque nearly completely black color.  Aroma is unexpected.   Redolent of Grahm crackers, smoke, tar, some roasted coffee and grain.  Flavor starts off just as odd, the oxidation is apparent.    I really want to get my hands on a fresher botte.

33cl bottle, with thanks to sunevdj.  Pours a nice dark brown that sits deep black in the glass, thick pillowy dark brown head that lingers, decent lacing.  Aroma is quite full, with espresso roast, milk chocolate, molasses, a good amount of smoke, and some subtle soy.  Flavor has lots of roast, with more coffee, chocolate, molasses and some dark fruits coming out.  Enjoyable and warming on a cold night!

33cl Bottle from Papsoe, BB Dated 27 08 07; Nose of chocolate, coffee, and roastinees with a light smoke; black with a good sized rusty tan head; flavor of chocolate, hop bitterness, coffee, and a nice hop finish. Excellent!

Comments: A bit weaker than I thought, but I guess a remarkable value for the price. Surprisingly light-bodied, but well extracted coffee bean flavours with soy disturbances and more alcohol and hops Id have expected  probably more than any 3 Carlsberg beers.

Pours dark brown with a tan head.  Smells of roasted coffee, chocolate, some nuts, some dark fruit.  Tastes chocolatey with some nice roasty qualities and touches of licorice.  palate is oily.  This has a lot of malt character.

bottle. pours black with tan head. nose has a tight roast to it, with dark chocolate and coffee. flavor is mainly dark chocolate, some roast, raisins, and the finish is smooth and dark fruity. a touch of tar lingers throughout. mouth feel is bit sticky and carbonation is smooth. odd how the neck calls it a porter and the body label calls it an imperial stout. for what its worth it seemed like a baltic porter being more on the chocolatey/roasty side. this brewery may suck but this beer is great.

Bottle from Papsoe, sampled with Zinister.  Thanks!Oh     my      goodness... this is goooood stuff.  One of the best beers Ive ever had.  Pours darker than 2am in the Sonoran desert with an aroma of cocoa infused chocolate covered cherry.  Tastes like a fresh batch of roasted cocoa topped with chocolate syrup with a side of coffee.  If this doesnt coat your tongue right, nothing will.  This is one incredible beer.  I shouldve hoarded this one out of Zinisters reach!!!

text: UPDATED: SEP 30, 2007 Much thanks to Papsoe for this treasure. Dark as night with a wonderful thin dark mocha head. Roasted coffee beans mixed with dusty chocolate covered cherries and cocoa powder. Oh my god...an incredible flavor! Thick, full bodied velvety mouth feel....roasted african coffee beans, mocha, chocolate....oh my love this is good.

(Bottle, BB 27.08.07)  Pours an opaque black body with a thick creamy tan head.  Aroma of chocolate, roastiness, and light coffee.  Flavor of roasted malt, milk chocolate, caramel, and some dark fruit with a very dry, bitter finish.

Bottle from Rastacouere.  Black body topped by a tan ring of foam.  Nose is black beans in soy sauce.  Taste of burnt soy sauce, over-toasted bread, molasses and raisins.  Very very roasted with even a light ashes presence.  The roastiness level is not too aggressive but might be a bit too extreme for its own good.  Medium body, medium carbonation and long finish.  Decent but forgettable.  Ratebeer category is Baltic Porter.  Whatever.  I dont know what it wants to be and with a neck label saying "Porter" and a body label saying "Imperial Stout" Im not sure the brewer knows either.

My Bottom Line:
An intriguing nose suggested sweet black beans and quality soy until heavily roasted malts and their bready undertones quickly burned the back of the palate. Well put together and highly flavorful, it sadly goes overboard in the finish and thus reduces my enjoyment quite drastically.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A veil of foam covers the brown-sleeved black.
-The smooth carbonation helped drinkability, but that roasty bitterness was somewhat excessive.
-Didnt get much of the yeasty fruitiness Id associate with the Baltic Porter style...
-Paired with a duck rillette, it actually grew better, as the fat lended some backbone to the brash roastiness.

Bottle; best before 27/08/2007; thx David!
Sampled at Chris_Os Shindig; Aug. 2007: Metallic, mild, fruity nose, a little musty; chewy body; silky palate; much nicer flavor vs. nose.
0.5 l bottle. Black color wit creamy tan head. Roasted and smoky aroma. Roasted flavor with charcoal, tar, smoke and some acidity. Dry charcoal finish.
Flaske. Fantastisk flot sort øl, med et klassisk porterskum der glider ned i øllen. Smagen er ikke så gennemtrængende, men er dog yderst behagelig. Meget drikbar.
Bottle, Chris_o shindig. Coffee, chocolate, iodine, fish aroma. Velvety soft palate, mineral, chocolate flavor. Even  late in the tasting, this was a fine beer.

UPDATED: SEP 9, 2007 RB # 1200: 33 cL bottle. Pours deepest brown/black with a chocolate brown and thick head. Roasted malt and slight chocolate aroma, smooth. Medium bodied. Coffee, roasted malt and slight chocolate smoothness in the flavour. Slight nutty. Nice bitterness in the finish blendin smoothly in with the malty notes. Smoothness is the keyword to this brew rather than being imperial, greatly well balanced to _almost_ the same extent as Westvleteren.

Blind tasting at sk8vikings porter / stout tasting, beer no 2. Pours black with with little lacing head. Thick alcohol heavy liqourice aroma. Full bodied. Rye flavoured, chocolate, slight liqourice note. Soft roasted malty finish with a warming alcohol note. Has a somewhat aged feel to it. 6-4-7-4-13 3.4
Bottle at Chris_o Shindig.  Black with lasting tan head.  Very good imperial stout.  Intense.  Great intensity.  Black bitter choc, espresso stout.  Excellent.

Coffee aroma with hints of moccha and black currant. Black, brown head, good lace. Moccha, coffee, sweet, light bitter and roasted. On the sweet side but pleasant.
Bottled - Chris O shindig 2007 - A black beer with a smoky fishy aroma.  There is soy sauce and lots of saltiness in the flavour.  Found this a bit OTT and reminds me of Harveys Imp Stout.

Thanks to Jason Ugs for sahring.  Dark pour w/ a tan head w/ lots of spotty lacing.  Light roast malt aroma touch of licorice hints of a fruit I think is cocconut and a light alcohol.  Palate is full well caoted and creamy.  Flavor is rich and syruppy, chocolates some raisen a dry wood a touch of alcohol and a hint of aged tobacco.  This is delicious.

Thanks Jason.  BB 8/27/07.  The beer pours to a dark cola body with an ultra thin light tan head.  The aroma is coconut milk, rice milk, chocolate, and light coffee.  The flavor is roasted coffee and has an interesting coconut and subtle tobacco.  The palate is creamy and medium bodied.

Bottle. Deep dark brown in color with a nice off white head. Chocolatety caramel roasty aroma. Malty roasty chocolatety flavor. Coffee like roasty notes. Finish is malty and chocolatety. Complex tasting beer. Sweet tasting. Full bodied. Well balanced beer. Very nice beer. Drinkable.

Bottled, BB 8/27/07.  Poured black with a short cap of creamy deeper beige.. settled to a looser beige ring.  Aroma picked up airy coffee grounds, roasted cocoa powder, and some licorice notes.. Chuck found some coconut, but I didnt see it.  Flavor found roasted cocoa powder alcohol-fueled licorice, and molasses.. alcohol was definitely in there, but provided more of a complimentary influence.. chalky, thick chocolate and licorice ride through the finish.  Medium-bodied and thicker on the back end.. heavy chocolate and licorice at the finish with a long, very roasted finish to it.  Very good stuff!  Thanks Rene!

33cl bottle, dated 27.08.07, batch 818. Near black with a brown head. Coffee and burnt malt nose, lightly smoky. Intense bitter chocolate flavor, a bit burnt, some coffee. A thick, sweet roasted malt flavor shines through after fully warming. Excellent!
Bottle. Black colour with a tan head. Aroma is roasted, chocolate, coffee, fruit. Flavour is roasted, smoked, fruit, hop, chocolate, coffee. Nice beer.
Bottle. Pitch black with a mocha colored head. Sweet, roasted coffee aroma. Chocolate.Full body and a slightly bitter aftertaste. Not bad at all.
Thanks Immy. 330 ml bottle. Pours black with dark brown head. Roasted aroma , chocolate and coffee. Taste of chocolate and coffee with a bitter finsih.

Bottle. Black, clear-looking beer with a tan head. Heavy, roasted aroma with chocolate, coffee, molasses and a little sour note. Almost full-bodied, with a flavor of chocolate, coffee, molasses, sourness, a good dash of sweetness and some dried fruits. Quite sweet but dry finish with chocolate, molasses and coffee. Theres some warming alcohol in it as well, but thats just nice. World class beer. (070712)

Very black. Brown, dense head. Has to sit for while. Coffeeish aroma with smokey notes and some roasted malts. Powerfull licorice. Very roasted flavour with burned and lasting bitter finish. Licorice. More coffee. Underlynig malty sweetness. Very sugarsticky palate. Alcohol. Soft carbonation. Very good, very cheep. Not that complex. Prototypic old school baltic porter.

33 cl bottle.  Ebony with crema around and a patch of froth.  Aroma is rich and roasty with raisins, figs and licorice.  Some lime zest keeps it fresh.  Medium body starts very smooth with coffee, cocoa and prunes.  Melts away leaving sharp bittersweet chocolate and dry pith.  Everything you could want in a stout, uh porter.  Quite good.
Black body with brown disapearing head. Aroma is of roested malt and bread. Flavor is roasted, bready and sweet. Subtle notes of smoke. A burnt aftertaste that lasts long. Palate is thick and syrupy.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2013 Bottle at KØ07. Black colour, small brown head. Quite powerful flavour with some liquorice. Good, thick mouthfeel.

Bottle, 8.2%. A good roasted, creamy and bready aroma. Black colour. Dark brown head. The flavour is a lot like the aroma at first, but it also has some salt liquorice. The creamy note is probably what makes it better than other standard Danish Baltic porters.

Medium darkish brown head. Opaque black body. Milky chocolatey aroma with licorice notes. Very harmonic. Salty, minty deep chocolate taste with burnt caramel notes. Soft, velvety mouthfeel. Dry, salty cocoa aftertaste. Leaves stickiness on the lips. Very nice, but a bit dry and salty. (0.33l bottle.)

(Bottle) Pours black with a brown head. Dark malt aroma with roasted and burned notes. Malt also brings dark bread, coffee, caramel, some chocolate and tar. Small notes of rust. Some prunes.  Roasted, light burned flavour with concentrated coffee taste and some tone of caramel and liquorice. A bit tar-ish in the flavour as well. Some bitterness. Nice, soft and round mouthfeel. Near full body. Very nice imp with the malt in the centre.

330. Many thanks, Maria! You totally hooked me up again.
Pours a deep dark opaque black. Thick moussy medium-tan head sprouts and then runs away as soon as you move the glass. Spotty lacing here and there on the sides.
Smallish nose, even after warming up a bit. Lots of dust there, a little light chalk, baking chocolate, dark fruit.
Nice rich body, especially given the clean-drinking baltic porterness. Soft carb, assertive but well modulated flavors. Really carefully considered.
Mid-palate gets really roasty, and that toasty, ashy, char-y, chalky business starts happening. Finish is plenty of char and even a little hint of sticky resiny bitterness. This is fantastic stuff.

C-Bus 7.  Brown head over a very dark beer; the kinds that coats the side of the glass when you swirl it.  Nose of tar, alcohol and smoked ham.  Thick mouthfeel that is almost greasy.  Flavors of smoke, coffee, Bakers chocolate, roast grains and burnt caramel.  The finish had a long coffee bitterness.  Very nice beer.
Aroma of roasted coffee malts with some prunes. Black coloured with a lasting, medium brown head. Taste is sweet, with roasted coffeebitterness, bit creamy, some prunes and some smoke in it. Nice.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2007 Bottled.Thx rlgk
Almost black with a brown-ish head.
Salsty and burnt malty aroma.
Soft and smooth with fine bitterness and notes of sweet and dried fruits.

Courtesy of Papsoe. Thank you, Henrik. The aroma is coffee, black licorice, roasted figs and bakers chocolate. The body is a dark brown to black and holds a very lasting, mocha colored head that starts off about a finger thick. Lots of dark fruit with raisin, prune and plum followed by dark chocolate and some burnt malt notes, Very nice mouthfeel. Low sweetness. Roasty/burnt finish.
Dark color, large brown head. Aroma of coffee, licorice, bit sharp, spicy, bit smoked. Dry and bitter coffee taste, bit smoke, wood. Thick and creamy.

(Bottle, Ölbaren, Copenhagen, 19 May 2007) Black colour with creamy, brown head. Malty, roasted nose with chocolate and coffee (with cream). Malty, roasted taste with coffee and chocolate. Full body, rather dry. Creamy, smooth mouthfeel with chocolate taking over more than coffee after a while. Almost perfect balance. Seriously good beer. A wonder Carlsberg havent managed to destroy this little masterpiece. Go for it while its still around.
Bottle. Pitch black, darkbrown lasting head. Roasted malt aroma, smoky notes, smooth, some smoked fish. Malty and salty flavor, chocolate, cocoa, maliky and fruity notes.
C-bus 7.  Smokey and boozey aroma.  Black with a medium head.  The palate is a bit on the thin side.  Bitter coffee, and light bakers chocolate make up the flavor.  Pretty nice.

Pours an oily dark black with a deep mocha head.  Nutty roasted malt nose. Bottle presentation is well done.  Body is sweet and upfront.  A bit overwhelming.  Some sweet fruit and a nice dry finish that creeps thru the body.  A smokieness that is reminicent of lightly smoked meat. I wish Maria would have sent me two of these but that seems to be a pattern that is developing.  I suppose Ill have to plan a trip to Denmark.

Bottle shared at Columbus tasting 7 - Poured dark brown with a short tan head and some lace.  Aromas of dark chocolate, coffee, some smokey notes and lots of dark fruit.  Flavor is full of dark chocolate and dark fruits. Some smoke there too.  Oily palate with a soft mouthfeel and good carbonation.  Not bad.
Slight roasted malt and alcohol make up the aroma.Pours a very dark brown with a slight tan head.Slight chocolate and alcohol stand out in the flavor.Medium mouthfeel with some alcohol in the finish.
C-Bus 7 Bottle thanks to Madsberg: Poured black with a tan head. Aroma, smoky, dark fruits, some light chocolate notes. Flavor, chocolate, coffee, some smoky notes, and fruits. Pretty solid.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2008 A Mes rate: 
Bottle at the end of the night behind the Mikkeller stand at Ølfestival. Wish to god I could remember who gave us this so I could say thanks but alas after all the BGB I just cant remember. Sadly due to our inebriated condition our notes were a little thin on the ground also so in homage to the evening my notes stay as they are in the book... "caramel, malt, very smoky" thats it Im afraid. Damn good beer though!

Black body with brown disapearing head.
Aroma is of roested malt and bread.
Flavor is roasted, bready and sweet.
Subtle notes of smoke.
A burnt aftertaste that lasts long.
