Bottle: Literally black coloured, small and stable brownish head; a tinge of dark and roasted malt in the quite distinctive alcoholic nose; very robust bitter-sweet flavour, full bodied; chocolatey, roast-malty finish with a distinctive lingering bitterness in the salty aftertaste.........

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2007 Bottle from Kristian (mikkeller). Pours deep brown with and creamy brown head (think chocolate milkshake). Aroma is very roasty, along with some nutshells and perhaps some chocolate milk. Flavor of dried dark fruits, roast, nuts. Strong notes of tobacco mid palate, that carries through to the finish and lingers. Finish also has some alcohol and dryness, and the lager characteristics make an appearance as well.. A decent traditional baltic, but I liked Alderis Porteris better as far as flavor (this has a much better mouthfeel). Do not drink this cold, as the bitterness is unpleasant with the lager yeast.
Bottle. Black color with a beige head. Good complex roasted aroma. Very nice roasted body with notes of chocolate and a light coffee bitterness. Roasted mild palate.

Bottle (thanks rickgordon). Dark brown, small beige head. Heavy roasted malt aroma, dusty, with notes of coffee. Medium to full bodied, smooth mouthfeel. Starts  a bit sweet, ends dry with a bit of alcohol shining through.

Bottle at home.
Black with a light brown head, fine lacings. Aroma moerate/heavy malty (licorice, roasted/burnt, chocolate), moderate hoppy. Flavor moderate/heavy sweet, moderate bitter. Almost full bodied, soft carbonated.

UPDATED: AUG 12, 2007 Bottle: Tanks to Rickgordon: Dark brown colour, with a thin big brown head.
Aroma of dark chocolate,burned coffee beens,lots of malts,and a citric alc nose.
Flavor, is werry smooth coffee/Chocolate mouth feeling.Medium to full body, nice long alc bitter finish. Werry NIce!!

Pours a nice light syrupy dark brown almost black with a small foamy beige head.  Smooth sweet caramel malts, along with light roast and good nutty dark chocolate with nice smoked meats.  More smoke in the flavor compliments the roast and chocolate along with the light dryness in the end.  Ok body, moderate mouthfeel, with a good finish.  Pretty smooth.

Poured a black color, with no head, just tan bubbles, no lacing.  Aroma of chocolate, roasted malts, dried fruits, with light soy as well.  Taste was roasted malts, smoke, chocolate, tobacco, light soy, with a dry, roasted finish.  Thin mouthfeel.
(33 cl bottle) Pitch black color, thick brown head. Grainy with some smoke scent, also alcohol. Oily grainy smoke sasuage burnt malt taste. Roasted malt aftertaste. Tick mouthfeel, low bitterness.

Bottled. 
Dark brown colour, brown head. A beauty to look at! Sausage aroma. Thick body, full flavour and some smokiness. Very soft mouthfeel. Compact. Extremely thick flavour without straggling flavour compounds and complexity. Not hoppy. Much coffee. Good sipping beer. Good beer!!

Bottled. 
Dark brown colour, almost black. Pretty big, brown head. Tar dominates the aroma, also there is toast malt and surprisingly - almond paste, which is often more found in blonde beers such as bocks or barley wines. Tarry, burnt flavour with fatty mouthfeel, leaning towards  coffee. Chocolate is not even noticed. Bit fiery and pretty thick but not very complex, which is not a drawback at all. Great beer!

Really enjoyed this one.   Thanks Svend!   Quality black, rather than semi dark.  Nice interesting palate, just that added interest from a mid palate aroma.   Mid bodied, quite drinkable rather than a Knife and Fork beer.     Smoke in the mouth, but not on the nose?  Why doesnt carlsberg sell this in the UK!!!!  Madness.

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2010 Pitch black with a fine brown head. Aroma is roasted malts - chcocolate, coffee , smoke & caramel toffee. Easy smoke, liquirice & bitter dark coffee. Texture is medium filling & very smooth. Good lasting finish.  Nice!  Rerating Feb. 2010: Full bodied. Lovely roast with some smooth chocolate. Roasted bitter end with a vague warmth from alcohol. 3,9 again!

UPDATED: APR 7, 2007 Bottled (Thanks JensenTaster!). Pitch black, or enormously dark brown, opaque colour, small white head. Aroma is malts, slight roast and smoke. Flavour is strong smoke, roasted malts, coffee and alcohol. Very mouthdrying.   Aftertaste is roasted malts, smoke and aftera while a lot of ashes. Quite dry. Wellbalanced, but the ashyness is almost too much...

Bottled (BB 08/2007)
Almost pitch black color, small brown head. Smokey and roasted aroma. hints of smoked  ham. Starts with notes of vegetables, then roasted malts and dark coffee. Finish is alcoholic, roasted and followed by long smoked and roasted aftertaste. This one has potential, but it is not my instant favor.

I have looked very much forward to this pitch black beer with the brown, creamy head. The aroma reveals roasted malt, chocolate and a hint of smoke. The mouthfeel is oily. The flavour is smooth with notes of licorice, chocolate, preserved fruits, roasted malt, coffee and the bitterness is nice and harmonic. Yummi - what a nice big beer at a little price. 1983
Dark brown, almost black with a  tan head. Malty with roasted tones. Lots of coffee, chocolate and some caramel. Full bodied with a nice bitter finish.

As black as can be, little dark brown head. Aroma has dominating smoke with nice ham and roastiness, mild convenient alcohol and licorice also there. Medium to full bodied. Flavor is more hopped with biting dryness, smoke and strong roastiness also there. Aftertaste lasts with wooden smoke and dries even more with mild alcohol. Excellent beer.

Bottle @ Olbaren, Copenhagen.  Black with a light brown head.  Moderately aromatic.  Smoky, velvety and meaty malts.  Nice malt character.  Good body.  A good beer, but the microbreweries make better beer.

33 cl bottle. Black colour with a light brown head. Aroma of light smoke, roasted barley, also hints of coffee and vanilla. Very tasty flavour of roastedness, coffee and quite bitter finish. Ends up very smooth abd nice. Pretty good for a commercial brewery.

Bottle. Pours almost pitch black with a big, fluffy brown head. Nice lacing. Aroma is sourish with notes of cooked vegetables at first, but quickly gives way for roasted, tar, and barbecue notes. Flavour is sweetish, roasted and oily. Finish is bitter and dryish with remote alcohol notes. Slight grassy notes. Smooth and soft palate. 16-03-07.

Bottle. Pours pitch-black with a light brown creamy head. Aroma is primarily roasted - some coffee as well. Flavour has lots of roasted tones. Very oily mouthfeel. Chocolate, coffee and a clear viniousness as well. Very sweet.
Black of color with a nice brown head. An aroma of old fahioned liqurice, coffee and roasted malt. Nice flavor of the same liqurice, coffee and roasted malt, some hints of sweet liqurice.
Bottle. Malty aroma with licorice. Malty sweet flavor, full bodied with licorice and dark roasted espresso. Warming alcohol. Very well balanced.
Bottle. Nice big tan head with good duration. Color is close to black. Aroma is roast malt and licorice. Taste is roast malt, coffee and licorice. Good long finish.

12 oz bottle, 2006 vintage, via henrikb.  Pours one of the deepest black colored bodies that Ive ever seen.  The head was rather small, dark brown, and faded to a whispy film and a thin ring.  The nose is a mix of roast, smoke, and caramel with a slight graininess.  Im also getting an off vegetal note and very light alcohol fumes.  Flavor is roasty and slightly burnt, and noticably lacking in the caramel that I expect of a Baltic, but its still strangely interesting.  I guess the caramel is there, but its more of a burnt caramel.  A little noticable alcohol on the finish.  Mouthfeel is full bodied with a nice oily thick texture and moderate soft carbonation.  This is one interesting beer.  Not sure its up there with my favorite Baltics, but it was certainly worth trying.

Bottle. Black color with a small light brown head. Aroma is light malty, dark chocolate, malt sweet, light hoppy, licorice, light smoke. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration (botterne is burnt or chocolate). Body is medium to fule, texture is creamy, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light alcoholic. (Generates sweet memories of old times drinking Wiibroe Imperial stout) ;o))

Black body with a huge light brown head; Medium sized balanced nose, meaty smoked aromas as well as roasted malt and dark red berries, but it also has this classic unfitting Carlsberg metallic scent; Huge soft carbonation in a soft textured body, balanced bitter and a little sweet, lacks character; It finishes medium long with quite some fill, a little bitter and sweet, balanced aromas. This is a good beer, but nothing more. I have had a few bottles of this new batch by now and and really think it needs a lot and especially more character to be as good as the average rating.
UPDATED: NOV 20, 2007 bottle. pitch balck color. large creamy head. burned aroma. great roasted chokolate and liqerice taste. very nice beer.
Bottle. Black colour with a huge mostly lasting light brownish head. Powerful aroma and taste of licorice, coffee and bitter chocolate. Incredible palate. Very good buy.
Bottled. Pours black in colour with a very large brown head. Great palete. Creamy and yummy. Roasted and malty with notes of coffee, dark chocolate and syrup. Nice hoppy finish.

Perhaps the best damed beer I ever have tasted. A dark brow full-bodied beer with a long after taste of coffee og a bit chololate. All most like Thisted Bryghuss Limfjordsporter or Samuel Smith Imperial Stout - only much better. Pleace do try it.

Bottled. An opaque black beer, topped with a low brown head. Looks delicious. Loads of coffee in the aroma along with roasted and burnt malts, dark chocolate , smoke and wood. Full and chocolately lavour with strong notes of pure cocoa, coffee, wood and dried figs. medium bodied which makes it dangerously drinkable. Long finish of wood, smoke and black chocolate. A masterpiece. I never thought I would say this but: Thanks Carlsberg (for bringing it back)!

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2014 Black with a light brown head. Roast, chocolate, licorice, charcoal and caramel aroma with a touch of wood. Dry and bitter flavour with loads of roast malt, a smoked note, hoppy, bitter finish and a hint of alcohol.

Bottle. A bit nervous on rating this old time  favorite being reintroduced on the market. To start with: The price is right. Buy it at the supermarket ! Brown and lasting head (promising). Pitch black body (interest increasing). Deep and powerful coffee choccolate aroma (getting exited now). Smooth well rounded coffee choccolate dried fruits flavor with a butter sort of ending. Long lasting aftertaste. Alcohol well hidden. I think my favorite is back ! Well why dont I give it a super rating then. Sorry mates no surprises.
Give me a Hallelluja go to Ølbutikken a nd buy this beer its so goood.A littel smoked with tast of liqorice chocolate and coffee.

[Tasted at Porter-/Stouteve at Carlsens.]

Welcome back to this revivaled beer after 4 years out of production. Notes of smoke and smoothness are the main notes of this brew and the rest is the usual notes of stouts. Very fullbodied and full of ingredients. Congratulations to carlsberg. PROBABLY THE BEST STOUT IN THE WORLD
Thick black with nice chocolate/brown head. Coffee, chocolate, smoke, roasted and liqorice. Strong taste, nearly american like!!!

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2010 Pitch black with a thick creamy tan head. The aroma is sweet malty with some roasty notes and chocolate. Caramel and light smoke. The flavour is sweet malty, light roasty, chocolate, light hoppy with light coffee notes. Nice creamy texture. Sweet roasty finish.  

3.5
Very black with brown top. Aroma very roasted and coffee but also some metalic thing I dont like. Taste is roasted coffee and the 8,2% alc is very well hidden. There is though some salty taste I dont like. 
Overall great value for money.

This reborn baby pours jet black in my glass and forms a dense, tan but rather weak head. The aroma is slightly metallic, put otherwise dominated by roasted grains and hops. Quite clean...
The taste is roasty, coffeish and a bit burned. Theres a slight note of liqourice. The bitterness is nice and full. And both from the hops and the black malts.
The only real flaw in this beer is the carbonation. Its a bit too aggresive and is in stark contrast to the finer nuances of this incredibly smooth and round beer.
Its a real treat at the stupidly low price of 10 kr (about 1,6 USD)

Pours black with a large light brown head. Smells of sweet malts and caramel. Sweet and slightly tart. Malty flavors with some roasted coffee. Hint of sweet fruits. Ever-so-slightly portish. he beerhas a very little hint of sweet liquirish. Full bodied. Medium carbonation. Long dry finish with a slight burning alcohol sensation. Nice, relatively mild Imperial Stout. Thanx to Wiibroe for taking this one up again.

Bottle. What a wonderful Imperial Stout for the prise of 10 Danish kroner. Quit impressive. Average creamy dark head that mostly lasted. Left some good lacing. Quit murky and black coloured. Heave malt with notes of coffee, molasses, chocolate, roasted, nutty. But also notes of horse blanket, toffee, smoke, tar, liquorice. Full bodied with a light oily texture and a flat carbonation. Moderated sweet with balanced bitterness to it. Bitter-sweet finish with an average duration. Quit good Baltic Porte. Welcome back!

One of the worlds best stouts is back. I love this style and Wiibroe Imperial stout has it all. Not to dry not to sweet, well balanced alcohol level and a smooth medium to full body. The Danish microbreweries could learn a lot from this beer

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2007 Its back! After being out of production for 8 years (when the original Wiibroe brewery closed) Carlsberg has now re-launched it. Black colour with a big long lasting creamy light brown head. Aroma of well roasted almost burned malts, coffee, bitter chocolate and hops. Great flavour of the dark roasted malts, good bitterness, coffee, prunes, raisins and a little tobacco. Long dry aftertaste with some alcohol. A super great Imperial stout! 7th of January 2007: It still kicks butt big time!

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2007 Bottle... best-by-date = May 1988... Pitch black ale with a small, well-tanned head. The nose provides notes of Play Dough®, chocolate, soy sauce and caramel. Sweet, chocolatey flavor. Medium-bodied with a milky mouthfeel and pillow-soft carbonation. Finishes chocolatey and sweet. An oldie, but a goody. Thanks to argo0 for sharing his bottle of this vintage brew!

33cl bottle, best-by date of May 1988 (!!), many thanks to argo0 for sharing this one.  Pours a pitch-black appearance with a miniscule tannish head and slight lacing.  Raisins, dark chocolate, vanilla smokiness in the aroma.  Slightest oxidation, medium-to-full mouthfeel, bitter chocolate dominates; raisiny, complex, layered palette; would benefit from slightly higher levels of carbonation (but at least it still has carbonation!).  A great beer thats held up remarkably well.

(33cl bottle, best by May 1988, many thanks to BierKönig) Minimal brown head atop black body) Aroma is medium sweet, bittersweet chocolate, coffee, light smoke, very light oxidization.  Taste is medium sweet, milk chocolate, caramel, light coffee, raisin, burnt, smoke.  Smooth medium-full body, minimal carbonation.

330 ml bottle. Well aged sample (but I forgot to write down the BB date). Jet black body with small, light brown head. Pours with a thick fluid. Nice roasted coffee aroma with dried prunes. Flavor is sweet malt, chocolate, dry fruit and some vanilla. Sweet and bitter aftertaste, harmonic balanced alcohol level.

Rating # 2900. Bottle BB 1985. Pitch black colour with a small light brown head. Malty, raisin and plum sweet aroma with vague liqourice note. Malty, chocolate sweet flavor with notes of dried dark fruit and tobacco. Thanx to joergen for sharing this one.

Rating #3000.
Bottle. Best before 05-1985.
Black coloured with a beige head.
Aroma of dried fruits, prunes and liquorice.
Flavour of prunes, liquorice and chocolate.
Over the top, but still a fantastic beer.
Bottle a couple of years ago. Black, brown head., thick. Roasty malts, chokolade, fruits, dry. Very nice. Chokolade and bitter coffee in the aftertaste

Bottle. best before 2002, thanx to ask. Black colour with a small baige head. Roasted, dark bread, tar aroma and a light sweet dry, roasted, dark fruits, tar taste. Medium to full body and a light sweet, dry, light alcoholic finish. Great!

(Bottle 33 cl) Pitch black with a brownish head. Very full-bodied, extremely thick fluid - almost tar-like! Very dry, roasted notes but also some underlying sweetness. Very hoppy finish. The strong alcohol doesnt really shine through. 291099

Ok, what to rate for my 1000th rating? I really wanted to pick a special beer to celebrate my "anniversary" so I decided to open this, Wiibroe Porter Imperial Stout Vintage 1987 (BB: May 88), and share it with my beer geek brother and a couple of beer geek friends! I got it earlier this year from a collector who had kept it since back then and knowing that it might have been displayed on an open shelf in a light and warm room I was quite anxious to try it, fearing that it had turned skunky or something even worse. But man, was I in for a nice surprise.....Pours a rather thin tan head on a pitch black body. Heavy and full aroma with lots of chocolate, dark fruit, plum, vanilla, oranges and a tone of coffee. Flavor is very thick and heavy. Nice sweet chocolaty and malty with a woody tone (probably from the age). The beer tastes a little old and over the top but knowing that it probably came from the above-mentioned shelf I must say it matured very well. Still a tasty and very interesting stout and I do understand why it is the highest rated Danish beer (damn Carlsberg for killing it a couple of years ago.....).

Best before 03: Pouring a thick, black liquid with a cappuccino-coloured head. Extremely roasted aroma. Salty, watery and dry. Malt, chocolate and roasted coffee in flavour and finish. Smooth and dry palate. Liquorice, mocca and coffee-beans in aftertaste. Great mouthfeeling. Fantastic brew!

First of all I must admit: Im not much of a stout lover! This example was from 1990, and was a bit gloomy: black body, no head and lots of nuggets! the strong aroma and strong taste was bitter, smoked and vineous. The taste was stuck in my mouth for a very long time (whether that is good or bad). Way too special, odd and bitter for me!

Expired last year: Black,with a medium,khaki head. Head is lasting,with nice lace. Complex,subtle aroma. Touches of smoke,roasted malt,chocolate,caramel,and nuts. Nice carbonation,thick,creamy,body. Calm,flavors of caramel,nuts,burnt and roasty,malts. Finish is slightly bitter,roasty,very smooth.  So very smooth,and balanced with no acidity or oxidation. Many thanks to Mads,and the person that gave him the bottle to send!

best before 2003 - black colour with almost no foam, black chocolate and nutty aroma, toasted with notes of alcohol, full-bodied, oily with a robust bitterness, long dry bitter aftertaste of cream, alcohol and coffee - very well-made and deeply balanced - thnks to fiulijn for sharing it

Dark color; creamy brown head. Mid-strength aroma, with roasted malt; cheesy, cellar's mould, milk cream, light phenol Very good balance of strong characters: malt, roasted malt, liquorice, caramel, light coffee, nuts, sweet body (and strong bitterness at the end). Yes, it's very well brewed and pleasant.

Vintage from 1990, 13 years old. Almost completely black, no head at all. The aroma is very vineous, roasted malt and roasted toffee. Flavor is roasted malt, coffee, bitter chocolate, toffee, hints of rye. Very full bodied. By the way, there was nuggets in it. Very nice stout, although i would like to taste a newer one.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2007 Vintage, cirka 2 years old.Wow, First a great thanks to Jacob Lövenlund for sharing this one with me - I loved every sip. The color is black with a chocolate brown head though collapsing. The aroma is of chocolate, roasted malt, and hints of smoke - fantastic. The flavor is sweet malty with notes of roasted bread, coffee, chocolate, and slight smoke. A fantastic beer. I hate Carlsberg for discontinuing this beer - it was the best porter and maybe the best beer on the Danish market. Unfortunatly it is the big buck and not the flavor that desides the destiny of beers.The new release fresh: A pitch black beer with a huge very dark brown head. The aroma is sweet with strong note of chocolate and roasted malt as well as lighter notes of oranges. The flavor is very sweet with the alcohol tickling the tongue, and with notes of chocolate at first, which resides just a bit to give way to a roasted malt and coffee middle, before a quite bitter finish sets in with bitterness both from chocolate and coffee. [8/5/8/4/17=4.2]

Yes! Has a nose like those hard licorice candies in Scandinavia (Malaco, but without the salt!). The nose also has a little balsamic vinear scent too. Opaque balck color and a great frothy head - a handsome beer! Complex body of deep coffee and wood tastes. Roasted nuts too. The vinegar undertones allude to the aged quality of this beer. Dry bitter end that is chalky. Full body and just an excellent beer. A real treat. Thanks Martin and Jacob!

Ah - what a great treat from Jacob and Martin! Thank you so much! Licorice, chocolat and coffee nose. Opaque, light hazelnut brown had. Smoked, chocolate, roasted and coffee beans taste. Edgy, cause hops comes through in kind of agressive intervalls but still nice. What a great beer.

Black with a brown head. Pours very thick. Nose and body of liquorice, nuts and roasted malt. Creamy and silky feel to it, full-bodied, good balanced. Slightly bitter touch but smooth finish. This beer is slihtly more bitter and less sweet than Gl. Carlsberg Porter. The best porter from Denmark. A scandal that Carlsberg discontinues this porter to leave the market open for Gl. Carlsberg Porter. Shame on you Carlsberg! The beer I had was best before July 22, 2002. But it did not seem to be a problem.

Black Pour with a thick tan head.Nose is like those coffee/hot chocolate drinks that my wife likes so much. Mouthfeel is best described as velvety,silky,creamy, full bodied pick the one you like best. Flavor has all the usual suspects dark roasted coffee,bitter chocolate, dark fruit. Along with a smokinessthat cuts in near the finish. An excellent brew and my Thanks go out to madsberg for pleasure of drinking it.

black with a creamy tan head.  roasty and creamy chocolate milk aroma.  silky mouthfeel.  delicious and complex mix of flavours - bitter sweet cocoa, coffee, nuts, dark fruit, roast and bitterness.  lovely.
Black.  Creamy, roasty, some nuttiness.  Good flavour development.  Too bad they've discontinued this - Olenthusiaster mounting a campaign to save it hopefully?

A thing of beauty, black with a brown head.  The nose is sweet light chocolate with a good dose of roast and a touch of alcohol.  The body is very roasty with a welcomed alcohol bite that doesn't impede the long finish.  Very nice example.  Is there a bad baltic porter out there?
Creamy looking head, opaque black look. Initially very intensive, it hits you with its flavours completely unprepared. It does mellow with time. Nice one.
The best Danish porter, no doubt. So much sadder to read in the paper today that it is not going to be made any more after 2002.

UPDATED: NOV 10, 2003 Bottled: Impressive colour. Almost black with a chocolate brown head. This beer really want to be drunk. Chocolate, alcahol and roastyness in the aroma. The flavour is pretty complex for a danish beer. Coffee, chocolate and a nice touch of alcahol. Very wellbalanced. Nice bitter aftertaste. Hard to believe, that Carlsberg has decided to stop brewing this, and instead concentrate on Carlsberg Porter. Its a pity.
UPDATED: SEP 3, 2004 Perhaps better than Carlsberg's? Very rich. Bitter chocolate palate.
The most heavy of all the Danish stouts, but also the one with the most quality. Very nice palate.

The best imperial stout in the world. Much more powerful than both the British and the other Danish stouts. Wonderful black colour with a tasty and lasting brown head. Roasty and powerful aroma. The flavour is more bitter and less sweet than Gl. Carlsberg Porter. Superb palate. If you like Fernet Branca, like I do, youll love this beer.

Pours with a rich brown creamy head.  Looks almost nitrogen poured.  Some mustyness to the aroma but largely dominated by roasted scents.  Definitely fills the palate, taste literally bursts in the mouth.  Some chalky aftertaste.  Great caramel flavors and zesty hops.  This is a late evening imperial to be savored when the sleepy, snow-covered trees creak.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2003 Pitch black. Big fairly lasting brownish head. Very nice aroma of toasted malts, chocolate, and coffee. Flavour is powerful! Words like coffee, chocolate and licorice spring to mind. Finish is medium bitter, dry, somewhat sweet and alcoholic. Carlsbergs decision to cancel this great porter is another blow for the proud(?) Danish beer traditions.
very great stout, chocolate sweetness, with a bitter coffee finish, and a bit of a spice. top class imperial stout.
Brown-black colour, brown head. Big roasty aroma. Well-balanced roasty liquorice-flavour.
Almost black ,a very intensiv caramell and choclate arom,a taste of coffee,toast, and burnt leaf hmm..maybe to sweet tough for beeing perfect
Black and thich with rich beige head. Loads of chocolate in the nose. Sweet and full bodied, big coffee flavour, syrupy and salty finish. Flavourful and complex, but would gain from being less sweet.
Even though they make really bad beer in Denmark, this is the exception! A world class Imperial stout.
Great stout, chocolate sweetness (not too sweet), with a bitter coffee finish, and a bit of a spice, very yummy.

A very good brew.Its heavy and strong, with coffeish notes in the after-taste.

As a locally brewed Danish Stout, it cannot compete with, say, Murphys or even Guinness. But the brewers in old Elsinore (Hamlets town) certainly did a good job. Definitely the best of all stouts brewed in Denmark.
